airport.title: Welcome to Medan!
airport.desc: We know that you might feel a bit clueless and overwhelmed to visit Medan. Don't worry though, we are here to help. Just slide right or down to the section you are interested in.

transport.title: Airport Train
transport.pros: Fastest among the bunch, 45 minutes get you to city center.

transport.title: Damri
transport.pros: Cheapest option and various destinations are available (consult us!)
transport.cons: Not knowing which bus to take could make you stranded in an unfamiliar teritory.

transport.title: Airport Taxi
transport.cost: IDR 300K/car depends on how good you bargain
transport.cons: And don't order grab or gocar either! You might get caught.

eat.title: Macehat
eat.description: Although this coffee shop is usually packed with people, it is worth to squeeze in and try their signature Avocado Coffee Float. The strong taste of coffee blends perfectly with the soft texture of avocado juice, topped with sweet and chocolatey taste of chocolate ice-cream. They have various snacks as well, though the Avocado Coffee Float itself is already fulfilling enough. If you prefer the original taste of coffee, they sure have the qualification. The downside is you can't really stay for long to chat. But don't worry, you can always jump into another place.
eat.mira: The Avocado Coffee Float is good, but it's somehow too sweet to my tastebud. (3/5)
eat.junda: I'm not a big fan of coffee nor avocado, but mix them up together with ice cream, the result is pure delight. (4/5)

eat.title: Sop Langsa
eat.description: Since Junda was little, his mom often feed him bone marrow of cows or chickens. He grew up liking it ever since. Once he heard that Medan has a soup restaurant that allows you to drink the merry thing, he wasted no time going there. For those who fancy a bit more spine in their life, we recommend giving Sop Langsa a try. There was a catch to this place though, one table can only order maximum 2 servings of marrow soup as cow marrows are quite hard to come by, the rest of the table have to make do with regular beef soup. So if you came with a big group and all of you want marrow, divide your group into twos and pretend that you don't know each other.
eat.junda: A jolly in your belly. Though finishing the whole thing is known to be quite a chore. (3.5/5)

eat.title: Soto Medan Sinar Pagi
eat.description: Medanese usually eat this for breakfast. We know you've tried soto, but we swear this one will be different. Expect something like Soto Betawi, but it used coconut milk instead of dairy milk. The taste is richer, we guess it uses more herbs and spices inside. Mira likes it with beef inside, but Junda likes it mixed with the innards. The beef has rich smokey fragrance that blends perfectly with the soup. To add the perfection, it served with tasty green sambal. A helpful tip: mix the sambal with sweet soy sauce, you'll thank us later. The restaurant might seems busy all the time but we can assure you that they're the high-scorer in the Dinner Dash game as they will serve you quickly
eat.junda: Expect to get yelled at upon arrival, Medan-style. (4.5/5)

eat.title: Dimsum Nelayan
eat.cost: IDR 200k (for full belly and satisfaction), well depends on how much you eat
eat.description: Dim sum is not exactly Sumatera-flavored, but we strongly advise you to try one in Medan, specifically in Nelayan restaurant. Various types of dim sum are served there and will make you forget about your diet. Do try the leng hong kien (shrimp dim sum with mayonaise) and don't forget to add their special spicy sauce before putting it in your mouth. After stuffing lots of dim sum into your now happy belly, cherish your mouth by eating the dessert : durian pancake. Don't expect the pancake to be the round-shape American breakfast pancake. It's more like seedless durian fillings with fresh cream, wrapped with thin layer of pancake. If you don't like durian, try the avocado one, it's equally delish.
eat.mira: Prepare to get broke, as the waitress will keep coming with full tray of dim sum! (4/5)
eat.junda: Don't try durian pancake, try the avocado one instead (4/5)

eat.title: Mie Aceh Titi Bobrok
eat.description: Having Aceh as next-door neighbour, finding legendary Aceh cuisine in Medan is a snap. Having said, Mie Aceh Titi Bobrok is a must try as it is one of the best Mie Aceh that we've ever tasted, indeed. Our affection for them grew even more for their dirt cheap price. For less than 20k you can have a full plate of Mie Aceh right in front of you. Have it fried, stewed, or just a stir-fried (with a bit of soup, but not as wet as the stewed one). Choose Beef, chicken, or even the whole crab as topping. We love our noodles wet, as it brings more flavour that way. Our extra tip for you: this shop and Sop Langsa is located side-by-side so adjust your stomach accordingly. And oh, do order the martabak telor while you were here!
eat.mira: To me, no mie aceh tastes as good as Titi Bobrok (4/5)
eat.junda: Once you try this one, no other Mie Aceh in Jakarta will taste good. (5/5)

eat.title: Lontong Medan Kak Lin
eat.description: For the record, Medanese LOVES fat. They cook their soto with coconut milk, and they like to add more and more to their other typical breakfast : lontong medan. Lontong Medan to Medanese is like bubur ayam and ketoprak to Jakartans, they're everywhere in the morning. What makes it different with other lontong sayur is, it has lots of things inside other than the sayur itself; it has tauco udang, bihun goreng, spicy anchovy, boiled egg, and sometimes with rendang as well. Rich and heavy, for breakfast standard. We usually eat the one that Kak Umi sells in Johor but we thought it would be more convenient if you go to Kak Lin. It is located in the heart of Medan city, just accross Mira's high school. If you do not like having fatty breakfast, she also sells lontong pecal.
eat.mira: Don't blame me if you gain a few kilograms after this. (3.5/5)
eat.junda: Try Lontong with Rendang, best taste under the heaven. (4/5)

eat.title: Mie Ayam Akong/Acim (Since 1975)
eat.cost: IDR 35k for one bowl of mie ayam
eat.description: Kudos to our beloved friend, Decci, who introduced us to this place. We love it ever since. It's been here, cooking delicious mie ayam since 1975, where Decci's father and mother usually ate and chilled when they were young. We love it because it's different in a good way, not your typical mie ayam. The texture of the noodles is perfect, it has lumpia udang as the topping, as the addition to chicken and boiled eggs. The sambal and pickled chili will contribute to its perfection. Do drink the freshly squeezed orange juice afterwards to freshen your throat, it was not a regular orange juice. You're in heaven.
eat.mira: Should I book a ticket to Medan tomorrow? I'm drolling. (5/5)
eat.junda: Tastes sweet and salty at the same time, in a very good way. (4/5)

eat.title: Tip Top (Since 1929)
eat.address: Jl. Jend. Ahmad Yani No. 92 A-B
eat.description: This is the oldest shop in our list, established in 1929. Everything about this place screams old! They have dutch-period cashier registry and telephony that is now became parts of decoration, and also a wooden oven that is still fully functioning as some of their cookies are made in this oven. We haven't try too much variety from their menu, but the ones that we do try is exquisite. You could also try the beef tongue steak. If you like sate padang, this is one click better. They serve lots of alcoholic ice creams but you can tell them if you prefer it non-alcoholic.
eat.mira: Nice classic vibes but I prefer Es Krim Ria. (3/5)
eat.junda: Not as expensive as the outer appearance indicates. (3.5/5)

eat.title: Es Krim Ria (Since 1936)
eat.description: Mira's mother has been visiting this place since she was in elementary school with Mira's granddad. Which means that this is the classic taste that stood the test of time. She usually ordered ice cream soda and eat various assortment that served on the table. "I'm fanatic to the ice cream soda, and the bika ambon is delish!", she said. If the cake is not enough, you can always order martabak telor or sate padang from the stalls just in front of this shop. This is the place for you if you like Zangrandi in Surabaya, Tentrem in Solo, or Ragusa in Jakarta.
eat.mira: I like this kind of ice cream, light and not too sweet. It feels nostalgic. (4/5)
eat.junda: A very good taste, but was not easy to get here unless you rent a car. (4/5)

eat.title: Coffee Box
eat.description: If you landed in Medan on Saturday and fly back on Sunday, then unfortunately for you, you might be able to get only the drool. But fret not, Coffebox is the one-stop-solution for you. You can order lontong medan, sate kerang, mie rebus, martabak telor, Es Kietna, and various kind of foods here. ALthough to be fair, the taste was not as good as the original places we listed before. We love their Es Kopi Malaka and Bakwan Bumbu Pecel. Furthermore, it has cozy vibes and the so called instagramable (God, We hate this term) decoration. The place itself used to be an old town jail, so it have classic feel to it. We'd like nothing more that hanging-out here with friends.
eat.mira: When in doubt, go to Coffeebox. (3.5/5)
eat.junda: Can be crowded, but very nice when it was not. (3.5/5)

sightsee.title: Istana Maimun
sightsee.address: Jl. Sultan Ma'moen Al Rasyid No.66
sightsee.description: If London has Buckingham Palace as its icon, Medan has a palace as well, namely Maimun Palace, which was built on 1887. It is where the royal family from Kesultanan Deli lives until today. They are kind enough to make the main part of their palace to be opened for public. You can come and enjoy the beautiful architecture with vibrant colours, which an acculturation of islamic Melayu culture and Europe since the architect, Theodoor van Erp, was a Dutch himself. Expect to join massive crowd there, especially if you come on weekend. To enjoy the palace to the next extend, you can play a role as a member of Kesultanan Deli by renting traditional Melayu costume that rented there with fair price (approximately 15k rupiahs last time we went there). You can see Meriam Puntung (headless canon) there, which has a tragical backstory.

sightsee.title: Mesjid Raya Al-Mashun
sightsee.description: Just a walking distance from Maimun Palace, you can see a huge mosque. The combination of Middle Eastern, Indian, and Spanish elements on the architecture makes the mosque stands out. It was built in the year 1906 by the same architect of Maimun Palace. The mosque has octagonal shape and has 4 wings. The entrance fee is free but please dress respectfully; the women need to cover her head before entering the mosque. Align your visit with your prayer time, as we really like the interior and the ambience inside.

sightsee.title: Graha Maria Annai Velangkanni
sightsee.address: Perumahan Taman Sakura Indah, Jl. Sakura III No.7, Tj. Selamat

souvenir.title: Bolu Meranti
souvenir.description: If you said to your colleague that you just back from Medan but you didn't bring Meranti to office, your colleague won't believe you. This is the item that everybody think about when they hear Medan.
souvenir.audience: Office colleagues. Bolu meranti could stay good at room temperature for days. The cake can be sliced to tiny pieces, so big groups could enjoy them.

souvenir.title: Bika Ambon Zulaikha
souvenir.description: There are lots of bika ambon shops in Medan, but Zulaikha stood the most.
souvenir.audience: Office Colleagues. Like bolu meranti, bika ambon could stay good for days in room temperature, and could also be enjoyed by big groups.

souvenir.title: Sate Kerang Rahmat
souvenir.description: We've tried various sate kerang from various places in medan, and we agreed that sate kerang rahmat tops our list. The combination of spices and the shell is perfect. Once the shop hand you the box, it's hard to walk away without opening it, therefore you best buy some for your own consumption excluding the souvenir portions.
souvenir.audience: Household. Sate kerang could only stay good for maximum 12 hours at room temperature, and it was best served warm, so they are suitable for anyone present upon your arrival at home.

souvenir.title: Pancake Durian, Durian House
souvenir.audience: Loved ones, assuming your loved ones love durian. Pancake durian is quite pricey, hard to carry, and they get bad easily. You have to be sure the one you intend to give them to worth all the effort.

souvenir.title: Manisan Jambu
souvenir.audience: Household. Another item that gets bad easily. The good thing about them is that they are cheap and easy to carry around.

souvenir.title: Teri Kacang Medan Mak Upik
souvenir.description: This item is made in medan, sold by a medanese, with ingredients from local medan market. The owner might be busy when you got there, but you can always order them online via tokopedia.
souvenir.audience: your office mates, your wife, your husband, your parents, anyone really.
